resources.string: Please only invite people who know you, and who actively want to join this study.
The chapter is too short to be analysed.
Only the study contributors can request a computer analysis.
Request a server analysis of the mainline.
Make sure the chapter is complete. You can only request analysis once.
Or perform a stronger one on your device.
All SYNC members remain on the same position
Share changes with spectators and save them on the server
You can paste this in the forum or your Lichess blog to embed
Only public studies can be embedded!
Delete this chapter. There is no going back!
Clear all comments, glyphs and drawn shapes in this chapter

plurals.name: pasteYourPgnTextHereUpToNbGames
plurals.comment: It is possible to create multiple chapters in one go. Please try to convey this using a short translation.
plurals.item: Paste your PGN text here, up to %s game
Paste games as PGN text here. For each game, a new chapter is created. The study can have up to %s chapters.

resources.string: URL of the games, one per line
Yes: keep everyone on the same position
Delete the study chat history? There is no going back!

string.name: confirmDeleteStudy
string.comment: %s is replaced with the name of the study

resources.string: Delete the entire study? There is no going back! Type the name of the study to confirm: %s
Where do you want to study that?

string.name: onlyMove
string.comment: onlyMove The only possible move. This is a label that can be placed in a study of a past game. It may not technically be the only move, but the only feasible one.

string.name: zugzwang
string.comment:
zugzwang What zugzwang is: https://lichess.org/practice/intermediate-tactics/zugzwang/9cKgYrHb/ybYJ9gNa
This specific string is a label that can be applied to a position in a study, to indicate one side is in zugzwang.

string.name: unclearPosition
string.comment: unclearPosition It is unclear who is winning or losing.

string.name: novelty
string.comment:
novelty
A move in the opening that has not been played before. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_chess#theoretical_novelty

string.name: development
string.comment: development Used in studies - shows that the player made a developing move (e.g. pushing pawns to open their bishops in the opening).

string.name: attack
string.comment: attack A label that can be applied to a position in a Lichess study. Noun.

string.name: counterplay
string.comment:
counterplay A label that can be applied to a position in a Lichess study. Noun.
Generally describes a defending player who is under attack, and makes an attacking move elsewhere.

string.name: timeTrouble
string.comment: timeTrouble A label that can be applied to a position in a Lichess study. Noun. Indicates that a player had little time to think and make this move (clock was running low).

string.name: withCompensation
string.comment:
withCompensation
Compensation is the short-term positional advantage a player has in exchange for typically material disadvantage. Short term advantages involve initiative and attack. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compensation_(chess)

string.name: withTheIdea
string.comment:
withTheIdea A label that can be applied to a position in a Lichess study. Noun.
Shows that the player was following the theory around an opening, even after the initial opening moves.

resources.string: What would you play in this position?

This is a shared analysis board.

Use it to analyse and annotate games,
discuss positions with friends,
and of course for chess lessons!

It's a powerful tool, let's take some time to see how it works.

string.name: sharedAndSaveTitle
string.comment: As in: shared with other members and saved to database

resources.string:
Other members can see your moves in real time!
Plus, everything is saved forever.

string.name: studyMembersText
string.comment: %1$s and %2$s are icons that will added at runtime

resources.string:
%1$s Spectators can view the study and talk in the chat.

%2$s Contributors can make moves and update the study.

string.name: addMembersText
string.comment: %s is an icon that will added at runtime

resources.string:
Click the %s button.
Then decide who can contribute or not.

A study can contain several chapters.
Each chapter has a distinct initial position and move tree.

string.name: commentPositionText
string.comment: %s is an icon that will added at runtime

resources.string:
Click the %s button, or right click on the move list on the right.
Comments are shared and saved.

Click the !? button, or a right click on the move list on the right.
Annotation glyphs are shared and saved.

You can find your previous studies from your profile page.
There is also a blog post about studies.
Power users might want to press "?" to see keyboard shortcuts.
Have fun!

A study can have several chapters.
Each chapter has a distinct move tree,
and can be created in various ways.

Just a board setup for a new game.
Suited to explore openings.

Setup the board your way.
Suited to explore endgames.

Paste a lichess game URL
(like lichess.org/7fHIU0XI)
to load the game moves in the chapter.

Paste a position in FEN format
4k3/4rb2/8/7p/8/5Q2/1PP5/1K6 w
to start the chapter from a position.

Paste a game in PGN format.
to load moves, comments and variations in the chapter.

Yes, you can study crazyhouse
and all lichess variants!

Chapters are saved forever.
Have fun organizing your chess content!
Black defeat, but White can't win
White defeat, but Black can't win
Same as normal Lichess server analysis
Same as official broadcast tournaments. Five times stronger than standard.
Use your own engine settings. Your device should outperform broadcast quality at %s seconds per move.
Analysis upload failed. Try again later.
There is a server analysis in progress for this game. You can try again when that's done.
Your current local analysis can be published
You must enable REC before you can share local analysis to a study.
Server analysis on chapters created before local analysis was introduced cannot be upgraded cleanly. Older engine lines and comments will remain unless you remove them first.
Looks like a similar or better analysis already exists.
The server already has analysis of this strength.
